verses.verse: It happened after <WH310> these things, <WH1697> that the butler <WH8248> of the king <WH4428> of Egypt <WH4714> and his baker <WH644> offended <WH2398> their lord, <WH113> the king <WH4428> of Egypt. <WH4714>
Pharaoh <WH6547> was angry <WH7107> with <WH5921> his two <WH8147> officers, <WH5631> the chief <WH8269> cupbearer <WH8248> and the chief <WH8269> baker. <WH644>
He put <WH5414> them in custody <WH4929> in the house <WH1004> of the captain <WH8269> of the guard, <WH2876> into the prison, <WH1004> the place <WH4725> where Joseph <WH3130> was bound. <WH631>
The captain <WH8269> of the guard <WH2876> assigned <WH6485> them to Joseph, <WH3130> and he took care <WH8334> of them. <WH4929> They stayed in prison many days. <WH3117>

They both <WH8147> dreamed <WH2492> a dream, <WH2472> each man <WH376> his dream, <WH2472> in one <WH259> night, <WH3915> each man <WH376> according to the interpretation <WH6623> of his dream, <WH2472> the cupbearer <WH8248> and the baker <WH644> of the king <WH4428> of Egypt, <WH4714> who were bound <WH631> in the prison. <WH1004>
Joseph <WH3130> came in <WH935> to them in <WH935> the morning, <WH1242> and saw them, <WH2196> and saw that they were sad.

He asked <WH7592> Pharaoh <WH6547>'s officers <WH5631> who were with him in custody <WH4929> in his master <WH113>'s house, <WH1004> saying, <WH559> "Why do you look <WH6440> so sad <WH7451> today? <WH3117>"

They said <WH559> to him, <WH2492> "We have dreamed a dream, <WH2472> and there is no one who can interpret <WH6622> it. <WH3130>" Joseph said <WH559> to them, <WH6623> "Don't interpretations belong to God? <WH430> Please tell it to me. <WH5608>"
The chief <WH8269> cupbearer <WH8248> told <WH5608> his dream <WH2472> to Joseph, <WH3130> and said <WH559> to him, <WH2472> "In my dream, behold, <WH1612> a vine was in front of me, <WH6440>
and in the vine <WH1612> were three <WH7969> branches. <WH8299> It was as though it budded, <WH6524> it blossomed, <WH5322> and its clusters <WH811> produced <WH5927> ripe <WH1310> grapes. <WH6025>

Pharaoh <WH6547>'s cup <WH3563> was in my hand; <WH3027> and I took <WH3947> the grapes, <WH6025> and pressed <WH7818> them into Pharaoh <WH6547>'s cup, <WH3563> and I gave <WH5414> the cup <WH3563> into Pharaoh <WH6547>'s hand. <WH3709>"
Joseph <WH3130> said <WH559> to him, <WH6623> "This is its interpretation: the three <WH7969> branches <WH8299> are three <WH7969> days. <WH3117>

Within <WH5750> three <WH7969> more days, <WH3117> Pharaoh <WH6547> will lift up <WH5375> your head, <WH7218> and restore <WH7725> you to your office. <WH3653> You will give <WH5414> Pharaoh <WH6547>'s cup <WH3563> into his hand, <WH3027> the way <WH4941> you did when you were <WH7223> his cupbearer. <WH8248>

But remember <WH2142> me when it will be well <WH3190> with you, <WH6213> and please show kindness <WH2617> to me, <WH2142> and make mention of me to Pharaoh, <WH6547> and bring me <WH3318> out of this house. <WH1004>
For indeed, <WH1589> I was stolen away out of the land <WH776> of the Hebrews, <WH5680> and here also have I done <WH6213> nothing <WH3972> that they should put <WH7760> me into the dungeon. <WH953>"

When the chief <WH8269> baker <WH644> saw <WH7200> that the interpretation <WH6622> was good, <WH2896> he said <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> "I also <WH637> was in my dream, <WH2472> and behold, <WH7969> three baskets <WH5536> of white <WH2751> bread were on my head. <WH7218>

In the uppermost <WH5945> basket <WH5536> there was all kinds <WH3978> of baked food <WH4639> for Pharaoh, <WH6547> and the birds <WH5775> ate <WH398> them out of the basket <WH5536> on <WH5921> my head. <WH7218>"
Joseph <WH3130> answered, <WH6030> "This <WH559> is its interpretation. <WH6623> The three <WH7969> baskets <WH5536> are three <WH7969> days. <WH3117>

Within three <WH7969> more days, <WH3117> Pharaoh <WH6547> will lift up <WH5375> your head <WH7218> from off you, <WH8518> and will hang you on a tree; <WH6086> and the birds <WH5775> will eat <WH398> your flesh from off you. <WH1320>"

It happened the third <WH7992> day, <WH3117> which was Pharaoh <WH6547>'s birthday, <WH3117> that he made <WH6213> a feast <WH4960> for all his servants, <WH5650> and he lifted up <WH5375> the head <WH7218> of the chief <WH8269> cupbearer <WH8248> and the head of the chief <WH8269> baker <WH644> among <WH8432> his servants. <WH5650>
He restored <WH7725> the chief <WH8269> cupbearer <WH8248> to his position <WH4945> again, <WH7725> and he gave <WH5414> the cup <WH3563> into Pharaoh <WH6547>'s hand; <WH3709>
but he hanged <WH8518> the chief <WH8269> baker, <WH644> as Joseph <WH3130> had interpreted to them. <WH6622>
Yet the chief <WH8269> cupbearer <WH8248> didn't <WH2142> remember Joseph, <WH3130> but forgot him. <WH7911>
